item.title: Road surface and road markings damaged following works outside Beths Grammar School, 24th February
item.description:
Following recent works carried out outside Beths Grammar School, the road surface and existing road markings on Hartford Road have been significantly damaged. Sections of the carriageway appear worn and uneven, and several markings are now faded or no longer visible, which is affecting clarity for drivers and pedestrians. The deterioration has become noticeable over recent months since the works took place and is creating safety concerns, particularly during busy school drop-off and dismissal periods when traffic volumes are high. Clear and visible road markings are important for managing vehicle flow and maintaining safe access for residents and pedestrians. I am requesting that the Council inspect the affected area, assess the condition of the road surface and markings, and arrange for any necessary reinstatement or repainting to restore safe highway conditions.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hartford Road, Bexley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
